Yeah would you say fear is a bad thing but I guess you know it's what kind of fear is it
And who you ask probably so when I was a little kid I felt that that fear was bad and maybe a it was my subconscious working out the issues that I was going through so maybe it was good but as an adult

I also think that when it comes to fear that
It is something that can set of hedge or a boundary so that we remain faithful to God and then there is I'm not like a horrifying kind of fear but a a fear when we look at God
In who he is honoring him and that's a kind of fear too and I would say that's a that's a positive fear as well
Yeah actually the first use of the law would be an example of a healthy fear the fear of running afoul of the authorities that God has put in place the curb
That yeah restrained you from acting out on whatever sinful impulse you might have that might be against the law so in that case that would be a healthy of fear and a half
You're correct so like the the the first use of the law um why do people obey the law in in that sense it's because they're fearful of the negative punishment you know [laughter] and so it's like oh well I'm not going to do this because I don't wanna go to jail so you're not really a doing things
For a wonderful virtuous reasons but because you're fearful of the
Penalty but at the same time it's not like the man's trying to keep you down you know I mean it's it's really about protecting you as well as a maintaining stable society so while there's fear involved the overall goal isn't simply tear the
Overall goal is to Maine taint peace and to keep us protected and to keep us healthy
In the sermon Dr Hoffman said that all fears are really mirrors of the one fear the fear of death would you agree with that
I agree with that I might put it a little bit differently to me to death is one kind of loss okay and at least for me personally I think that a lot of my fear is connected to loss a death being probably the largest one but
Yeah I I Would say that the death as a form of loss and and if you think about it that way that many of our fears are connected so uh we're fearful if we're gonna lose our job or if we're going to lose a relationship with someone that we love or if we lose someone in in death or if we're going to lose part of our identity you know or part of our freedom
Um all of those I think go back to loss for me
And maybe it tells you a little too much about who I Am I'm but fear of loss of of of many kinds has has been something that that I've dealt with over my life uh it it also I think it exposes the fact that
Maybe we think that the things that we provide for ourselves are the only way that we make it through this world
And if we if we lose those things we're not going to be able to go on
So I think it probably also says something about my understanding of my of my trust and and my relationship with God and those types of fear
It seems to me that fear could also be a result of uncertainty not knowing where things are going to go and so you fear what could happen
Or exactly yeah I'm I'm One of those people that I I'd probably do myself a harm by thinking about all of the possible results of a situation you know so I can imagine like forty different horrible things that could happen [laughter] you know I'm so
Uh I I tend to I tend to let my mind think through those things and sometimes I noticed that that will that will actually impact me emotionally that I Will be fearful about a consequence that I have determined to simply be a possibility in my mind
And trying to realize that there's there's plenty of real things to be fearful about instead of just being fearful
Oh the thousand things that I make up
In his sermon Dr Hoffman says when fear is so ... you can cut it with a knife face cuts through and then there's light again no matter what may happen there is God and where God is no fear
Now I couldn't agree with that more you know as we're talking about this I only started the illustration as I was coming down here about the story of when I was a child
But thinking about that statement and also thinking about some forty six that he's using them is that a a a mighty fortress you know kind of thing I thought well I Know of course I didn't know this but uh in a way I was kind of building a fortress your own little forgeries clerics yeah with prayer
But that is true in the darkest times God is that defense he used that lights that cuts through that darkness we also know from scripture that a lot of times we don't necessarily see the light of God enlisted stark
Or to put another way we see it more clearly are more brightly when it's dark
So it's interesting that when you talk about faith and you talk about people's relationship with God through Christ that if you ask them to tell you a story about it many times they are going to tell you a story about darkness
A story about fear a time when God made a difference in their daily life so in many ways without these times of fear without this times of broken it's without these times of darkness
Maybe we wouldn't understand God's graciousness and provision as much as we do today [noise]
